casebody.data:
CARILLON
v.
NCDHHS, et al. No. 54A06. Supreme Court of North Carolina. November 1, 2006. Melissa L. Trippe, Mark A. Davis, Special Deputy Attorney Generals, Thomas M. Woodward, Susan K. Hackney, Assistant Attorney Generals, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Solicitor-General, for NCDHHS, et al. Forrest W. Campbell, Jr., Greensboro, Charles F. Marshall, III, Raleigh, for Carillon Assistant Living. Susan M. Fradenburg, Allyson Jones Labban, Greensboro, for Ridge Care, Inc.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 31st day of October *5472006 by Petitioner for Extension of Time to File Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Petitioner (Carillon Assisted Living) shall have up to and including the 20th day of November 2006 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court. By order of the Court in conference this the 1st day of November 2006."
